text: Personally I'd say there's better choices from both RoB and Dracula X, like Cemetary and Picture of a Ghost Ship. Still a good song though.

text: I was about to agree with you, but then I was reminded that 0:40 exists. It's just fucking perfect and magical.
author: Shecklesmack

text: it sounds good for a 16-bit gaming console :)
author: PokedroidTAS

text: Funnily enough, I couldn't see a SNES version of this particular track being as good as this. I guess it's proof that, when it comes to the other tracks, it may simply be because I heard the SNES versions first, mixed with the nostalgia.
author: SupraDarky

text: A lot of people would disagree with me, but having originally played the SNES version, I've always prefered the SNES version of this awesome soundtrack. Even if the sound quality is obviously not as good as the PC Engine version, I just love the crisp SNES sound they used. However, for some reason, this track never made it to the SNES. I find it's one of the more underrated tracks in Castlevania.
author: SupraDarky
